CIS-4.1.4.name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root

CIS-4.1.5.name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive

CIS-4.1.6.name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root

CIS-4.1.7.name: Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive

CIS-4.1.8.name: Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root

CIS-4.1.9.name: If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate permissions set to 600 or more restrictive

CIS-4.2.1.name: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false

CIS-4.2.10.name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate

CIS-4.2.11.name: Ensure that the --rotate-certificates argument is not set to false

CIS-4.2.12.name: Verify that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true

CIS-4.2.13.name: Ensure that the Kubelet only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers

CIS-4.2.2.name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow

CIS-4.2.3.name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate

CIS-4.2.4.name: Verify that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0

CIS-4.2.5.name: Ensure that the --streaming-connection-idle-timeout argument is not set to 0

CIS-4.2.6.name: Ensure that the --protect-kernel-defaults argument is set to true

CIS-4.2.7.name: Ensure that the --make-iptables-util-chains argument is set to true

CIS-4.2.8.name: Ensure that the --hostname-override argument is not set

CIS-4.2.9.name: Ensure that the --event-qps argument is set to 0 or a level which ensures appropriate event capture

CIS-5.1.1.name: Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required

CIS-5.1.3.name: Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles

CIS-5.1.5.name: Ensure that default service accounts are not actively used

CIS-5.1.6.name: Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary

CIS-5.1.8.name: Limit use of the Bind, Impersonate and Escalate permissions in the Kubernetes cluster

CIS-5.2.1.name: Ensure that the cluster has at least one active policy control mechanism in place

CIS-5.2.10.name: Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned

CIS-5.2.11.name: Minimize the admission of Windows HostProcess Containers

CIS-5.2.12.name: Minimize the admission of HostPath volumes

CIS-5.2.13.name: Minimize the admission of containers which use HostPorts

CIS-5.2.2.name: Minimize the admission of privileged containers

CIS-5.2.3.name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace

CIS-5.2.4.name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace

CIS-5.2.5.name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace

CIS-5.2.6.name: Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation

CIS-5.2.7.name: Minimize the admission of root containers

CIS-5.2.8.name: Minimize the admission of containers with the NET_RAW capability

CIS-5.2.9.name: Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities

CIS-5.3.2.name: Ensure that all Namespaces have Network Policies defined

CIS-5.4.1.name: Prefer using secrets as files over secrets as environment variables

CIS-5.7.1.name: Create administrative boundaries between resources using namespaces

CIS-5.7.2.name: Ensure that the seccomp profile is set to docker/default in your pod definitions

CIS-5.7.3.name: Apply Security Context to Your Pods and Containers

CIS-5.7.4.name: The default namespace should not be used
